subtitle: This salad can be served as a light lunch, served with crusty bread, or as an accompaniment to a barbecue.

method.text: Mix the ingredients for the dressing together.

Peel the beetroot and cut into matchstick pieces. Halve the apples across the centres, remove the cores but do not cut away the peel. Carefully cut away most of the flesh of the apple, leaving a thin rim of fruit inside the skins.
Cut the removed apple flesh into small pieces, put into the dressing and leave until the salad is required.
Blend the beetroot, apple flesh and most of the nuts. Spoon into the apple cases and top with the last of the nuts and the sesame seeds.
Stand the apple halves on lettuce and spoon the remaining dressing over the salad just before serving.

title: Beetroot and apple salad
